intro: Suchtelenia acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiny-fruited Suchtelenia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like and covered in spines, which aid in seed dispersal by animals. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
